Curator: Bill Bug[[Category:Aplysiidae]]* Externally Sourced Definition: [[externallySourcedDefinition::* An opisthobranch mollusk of the order Anaspidea. It is used frequently in studies of nervous system development because of its large identifiable neurons. Aplysiatoxin and its derivatives are not biosynthesized by Aplysia

but acquired by ingestion of Lyngbya (seaweed) species. (MSH) * genus of motile gastropods with a poorly developed or missing shell; used in neurobiology studies because it possesses a simple nervous system with large
